Articles.Content: Post whether or not you like reddit.
Neither, really. I don't use it, but not because I don't like it. I just never see a reason to go.
It's a place to read everything about nothing all at the same time.
It confuses me and I don't care about it.
You try to quit it, but you just keep coming back

I just registered today, actually. I usually visit KSP, pixelart, and minimalism.

The idea seems awesome: Have a site where you can discuss anything with anybody, but do it in groups so that you don't get a total mess.

The execution, however, is totally wrong. It just looks like a site that hasn't been updated since 2008.
I like it, but prefer imgur. Imgur master race!
Good but not great. The way votes are processed introduces bias. Look at Hacker News for comparison.

I don't like the way it's structured/presented. It's largely impossible to find something you are searching for; the board instead emphasizes showing you only what the community at large thinks you should be seeing. On one hand, the voting system (if used correctly, which it often isn't) can greatly raise the quality of the content by filtering out junk and unrelated information, but on the other hand, it results in a self-perpetuating content bubble that only allows popular content a short-lived window of attention. There's no chronology maintained and threads disappear relatively quickly, to be replaced by something else.

It's an interesting system, but it's not for everyone. It certainly isn't for me.

I like it.

I lurk the KSP reddit most days. The history pron reddit is awesome to visit sometimes.

I like it, but prefer imgur. Imgur master race!

Fun fact: Imgur was created as a gift to reddit.

Fun fact: Imgur was created as a gift to reddit.

That's why they're "sister" sites. I love imgur.

One awesome site to visit is: http://www.reddit.com/r/LetsNotMeet/ I hate it but love it.
